greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Analog of A056239 for nonstandard factorization based on the sieve of Eratosthenes (A083221).
comment: Each n occurs A000041(n) times in total.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences generated by sieves
program: ordinal_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), pt); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), pt = mapget(om, invec[i]), pt = 0); outvec[i] = (1+pt); mapput(om,invec[i],(1+pt))); outvec; };
A020639(n) = if(n>1, if(n>n=factor(n, 0)[1, 1], n, factor(n)[1, 1]), 1); \\ From A020639, by Hasler.
xref: Cf. also A253557, A302041, A302050, A302051, A302052, A302055 for other similar analogs.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 31 2018
